title.native: 邪神ちゃんドロップキック’（ダッシュ）

description:
The second season of Jashin-chan Dropkick.

Jashin-chan is a demon who was summoned by Yurine Hanazono, a gothic looking girl. Unable to return home as the relevant spell was not included in the summoning grimoire, Jashin-chan resorts to violence to liberate herself from her earthly shackles.

However, this is easier said than done, as Yurine is no weakling herself. She in fact possesses formidable physical power and uses it to massacre Jashin-chan in a variety of ways, be it shoving her arm in a blender, spreading her intestines across the room or even cooking her. Though these actions would be fatal to anyone without the ability to regenerate, Jashin-chan isn't exactly undeserving of this treatment. Stuck with each other, Yurine lets Jashin-chan live with her in exchange for work around the apartment, and this cohabitation results in situations where, more often than not, Jashin-chan ends up in pieces.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

Note: All episodes premiered on Amazon Prime Video Japan and Crunchyroll on April 6th, 2020. The weekly TV broadcast started on the same day.
hashtag: #邪神ちゃんドロップキック
synonyms: Jashin-chan Dropkick ภาคที่ 2

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.description: Centered around the game of mahjong.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/pentaroux) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/254061)

__Website | Twitter | Instagram | YouTube__ Introduction: Halca is a Japanese musician affiliated with company Music Ray'n and signed to label Sacra Music. She had a major appearance as the opening act during the CHiCO with HoneyWorks 2017 tour. In 2018 she released her first single called "Kimi no Tonari", which was used as the ending theme for the anime "Wotakoi: Love is Hard for Otaku". Her other appearances have been in anime such as: Ace Attorney, Kaguya-sama: Love is War and We Never Learn!: BOKUBEN Season 2 Biography: Halca started with an interest in music from early childhood. She was heavily inspired when she one day received a copy of the song "Again" by YUI. While in junior high school, she discovered that her home's cable TV had an anime channel, which is also the way she became familiar with anime music in general. She would watch this anime channel on a daily basis, which slowly began to impact her future plans. The biggest impact from the several anime shows she watched in her childhood, were shows such as Cardcaptor Sakura and Toradora!. The anime that had the biggest musical influence ended up being the song "Kiss Kara Hajimaru Miracle" from the anime Steel Angel Kurumi, which became her favorite anime song. She decided to join her school's choir club and broadcast theater club later on to hone her vocal skills, as she started to take an approach to singing herself. After honing her skills in school she officially decided to pursue a career as a musician. Halca had a lot of singing auditions to consider, but the audition that piqued her interest the most was for the Utakatsu! Audition, which focused on anime songs. She decided to participate in the audition for Utakatsu!, and she ended up winning the grand prize in 2013. She didn't let win go to her head, however, as after the winning the audition she continued to train her vocal skills while waiting to make her major debut. In 2017 she was invited by the singer CHiCO, known primarily for her involvement in the group HoneyWorks (alongside Gom, Shito and Yamako), to perform in the latter's 2017 live tour as their opening act. Following her opening act, she performed the song "Kimi no Sora" ("Your Sky"), which was included in a compilation album released to celebrate the 10th anniversary of the online novel publisher Noichigo. She also performed with the song "Resonator", which was used in the original soundtrack for the anime series "Beatless", and she also made a mini-album titled White Disc, which was sold during the HoneyWorks tour. Halca made her major debut later in 2018, with the release of her first single "Kimi no Tonari" ("Next to You"), which was used as the ending theme for the anime Wotakoi: Love is Hard for Otaku. To commemorate the release of her first single, the mini-album White Disc was made available for sale during the single's release event. Her second single "Starting Blue" was released in October 2018, with the title track being used as the ending theme for the second season of the anime Ace Attorney. Her third single "Sentimental Crisis" was released in February 2019, the title track was used as the ending theme for the anime Kaguya-sama: Love is War. Her fourth single "Houkago no Liberty" was released on November 13, 2019, the title track was used as the ending theme to the anime We Never Learn!: BOKUBEN Season 2. (Source: [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halca), edited)

__[Website](https://zamb.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ZAMB_OFFICIAL)__ | __[Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3o6Ly3CvDVlxXoBvUOWhxg)__

__Formed:__ 2019

__Introduction:__
Zuga Anisong Metal Band (stylized as ZUGA ANISONG METAL BAND), more commonly known as ZAMB, is a Japanese 2.5-dimensional metal band centered around vocalist Izumi Zuga and guitarist GAK. The band is known to arrange and perform metal type covers of anime songs on YouTube, but have recently started making their own songs.

__Biography:__
The band originally started arranging and performing metal covers of famous anime songs on their official YouTube channel. The first cover they uploaded on October 19, 2019 was that of [Nami Tamaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100549)'s song titled "[Believe](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ygHxfpxP5mo)", which was originally used as the third opening to the anime [Kidou Senshi Gundam SEED](https://anilist.co/anime/93/Kidou-Senshi-Gundam-Seed/). 

They have also covered and uploaded other anime songs such as "[Connect](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OrgpX-_bFqM)" by [ClariS](https://anilist.co/staff/106746/ClariS), the first opening theme to [Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/Mahou-Shoujo-MadokaMagica/), "[Sobakasu](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qq61e-LtJTU)" by [JUDY AND MARY](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judy_and_Mary) and "[1/3 no Junjou na Kanjou](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eozm37T1Emg)" by [Siam Shade](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siam_Shade), the first opening and sixth ending to [Rurouni Kenshin](Rurouni Kenshin: Meiji Kenkaku Romantan), "[Sekai ga Owaru Made Wa](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t4LNd7rlfGA)" by [WANDS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wands_(band), the second ending theme to [Slam Dunk](https://anilist.co/anime/170/Slam-Dunk), and "[GO!!!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AE4b9jO1uB4)" by [FLOW](https://anilist.co/staff/100253/FLOW), the fourth opening theme to [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/Naruto/).

On March 7, 2020, it was announced that the band would debute in anime with the upcoming single titled "Love Satisfaction", which was performed as the ending theme song to [Jashin-chan Dropkick’](https://anilist.co/anime/107294/Jashinchan-Dropkick/). The full version of said single will be released on June 10, 2020 along with a second song titled "君に幸あれ" ("Good luck to you") and instrumental versions of said songs.

__Members:__
- [Izumi Zuga](https://anilist.co/staff/162580/Izumi-Zuga) (図画泉美) - vocalist, in-charge of lyrics
- [GAK](https://anilist.co/staff/162584/GAK) - vocalist (screams), guitarist, in-charge of arrangement

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/zamb_zuga)__

__Tomoya Kawasaki__ is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger and guitarist.

__[Profile (Scoop Music)](https://www.scoop.co.jp/creator/detail.php?cd=2)__

__Kazuhiro Hara__ is a Japanese keyboardist, pianist, guitarist, programmer, composer and arranger.

Franz Peter Schubert was an Austrian composer of the late Classical and early Romantic eras. Despite his short lifetime, Schubert left behind a vast oeuvre, including more than 600 secular vocal works (mainly lieder), seven complete symphonies, sacred music, operas, incidental music and a large body of piano and chamber music. His major works include the Piano Quintet in A major, D. 667 (Trout Quintet), the Symphony No. 8 in B minor, D. 759 (Unfinished Symphony), the ”Great” Symphony No. 9 in C major, D. 944, the three last piano sonatas (D. 958–960), the opera Fierrabras (D. 796), the incidental music to the play Rosamunde (D. 797), and the song cycles Die schöne Müllerin (D. 795) and Winterreise (D. 911). (Source: Wikipedia)

**Height:** 147 cm
**Hobbies:** Singing, drawing, watching anime

[Website](https://suzukiaina.jp/) | [Profile (IAM Agency)](http://iamagency.sukurepo.jp/actors/women/suzuki_aina) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aina_suzuki723) | [Agency Twitter](https://twitter.com/AinaSuzuki_Info) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpNypDVlaMyJDx7P8u3dd-A)

She debuted as a voice actress in 2014. She is also skilled in the Minyou (民謡) genre, which is a genre of traditional Japanese music, where she won many competitions.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Sakawa - Azur Lane (VG)
